head.title: Three in a Row For Hartmann

hedline.hl1: Three in a Row For Hartmann

block.p: Rick Hartmann, who formerly played on the European Tour, two-putted for birdie on a par-5 first extra hole yesterday at the Cold Spring Country Club to defeat Michael Laudien and win the MasterCard Long Island P.G.A. Championship for the third straight year.

Hartmann, the head professional at the Atlantic Club in Bridgehampton, N.Y., earned $4,000 for the victory that enabled him to match a feat achieved by Al Brosch of the Cherry Valley Club in Garden City, N.Y., from 1949 to 1951.

Rick Hartmann, who formerly played on the European Tour, two-putted for birdie on a par-5 first extra hole yesterday at the Cold Spring Country Club to defeat Michael Laudien and win the MasterCard Long Island P.G.A. Championship for the third straight year.

Hartmann, the head professional at the Atlantic Club in Bridgehampton, N.Y., earned $4,000 for the victory that enabled him to match a feat achieved by Al Brosch of the Cherry Valley Club in Garden City, N.Y., from 1949 to 1951.
Laudien, of Glen Oaks, had forced a playoff by sinking a 25-foot birdie putt on the 18th hole.

The final of the MasterCard Westchester P.G.A. Championship at the Siwanoy Country Club was postponed until this morning by a police investigation at the Bronxville course. The Westchester County and Bronxville police would not allow the finalists, David Young and Carl Alexander, to play in the afternoon after each won a morning semifinal.
